SECTION TWO
COMMUNICATIONS AND THE ANTI-POVERTY PROGRAM
People living in poverty and disadvantage usually
refer to themselves as "too dumb," to go to
school, or to learn anything "new." They often
are heard to say that learning is "too hard."
These are some ways the individual has "learned"
to describe these things.
"What good is having an education, anyÂ¬
way? You never get to use it."
"No one will believe me when I tell
them that I finished school, anyway,
so why bother?"
"No one around here cares if I get an
education or not, so why should I make
the effort?"
